metadata.title: CVE-2024-2610 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
Using a markup injection an attacker could have stolen nonce values. Thiscould have been used to bypass strict content security policies. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox < 124, Firefox ESR < 115.9, and Thunderbird <115.9.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-2610` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:115.9.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:115.9.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:115.9.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:115.9.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:115.9.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:115.9.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
No subscription required
